title: Road textures overdraw LIDAR visualization in gzclient

content.html:
In Gazebo 8.6 published road messages, such as 

name: "Road_1_3531551"
width: 6
point {
  x: -358.30692360555969
  y: 196.53521005846258
  z: 0.05
}
point {
  x: -334.35436988133006
  y: 183.50174461258575
  z: 0.05
}
point {
  x: -305.99414504831657
  y: 167.79828227683902
  z: 0.05
}
point {
  x: -288.27405962743796
  y: 158.47638747887686
  z: 0.05
}
point {
  x: -277.98349802428856
  y: 152.77515100967139
  z: 0.05
}
point {
  x: -263.16898512851913
  y: 144.9845476616174
  z: 0.05
}
point {
  x: -219.28896547248587
  y: 121.84251950494945
  z: 0.05
}
point {
  x: -203.80831274669617
  y: 113.66241469373927
  z: 0.05
}
point {
  x: -192.57274823591811
  y: 107.80757289669685
  z: 0.05
}
material {
  script {
    uri: "file://media/materials/scripts/gazebo.material"
    name: "Gazebo/Primary"
  }
}

overdraw ray-based lidar sensor visualizations in the gzclient. This is the fact, if the lidar visualization lies in between the road texture and the camera's viewpoint. I attached a screenshot, which demonstrates it:
